column4: az[a] zel_ubuntu: I think you'll find that will rise if you do something cpu intensive (compiling for example)
yeah I just found that :) cool, I wanted to know how to turn that on in my normal distro (mandrake), but seemed to hard to setup.. but it just works in ubuntu and I never even noticed, heh
but lets say I do want to run flat out all the time, is there a way to do that?
yeah, which is why I've become a bit more interested in gnome
